title: Mitsubishi 4N1 engine
text:
The Mitsubishi 4N1 engine is a family of all-<a href="alloy">alloy</a> <a href="straight-4">four-cylinder</a> <a href="diesel%20engine">diesel engine</a>s developed by <a href="Mitsubishi%20Motors">Mitsubishi Motors</a>, produced at the company's powertrain facility in <a href="Kyoto">Kyoto</a>, <a href="Japan">Japan</a> for use in Mitsubishi's small to mid-sized global passenger cars.
In June 2006, Mitsubishi Motors and <a href="Mitsubishi%20Heavy%20Industries">Mitsubishi Heavy Industries</a> announced a joint development <a href="project">project</a> for a new generation of clean diesel engines to be used in cars <a href="export">export</a>ed to <a href="Europe">Europe</a> with a target of beginning <a href="mass%20production">mass production</a> in 2010 and later announced that the engines will be gradually phased into other global markets.
The preliminary version of the engine was first seen in the <a href="Mitsubishi%20Concept-cX">Concept-cX</a> test car introduced in 2007. The larger was first exhibited in the <a href="Mitsubishi%20Concept-ZT">Concept-ZT</a> test car introduced in the same year and later used in the <a href="Mitsubishi%20Concept-RA">Concept-RA</a> test car introduced in 2008.
With a clean diesel emission performance in mind, all engines are designed to comply with <a href="US%20emission%20standard">Tier 2 Bin 5</a> emission regulations in the <a href="United%20States">United States</a>, <a href="European%20emission%20standards">Euro 5</a> standard in Europe and <a href="Japan">Japan</a>'s <a href="Emission%20standard%23Japan">Post New Long Term</a> regulations.
Together with <a href="MIEV">Mitsubishi's electric vehicle technology</a> the new diesel engines are positioned as a core element in the Mitsubishi Motors Environment Initiative Program 2010 (EIP 2010) announced in July 2006.
The 4N1 engine family is the world's first to feature a <a href="variable%20valve%20timing">variable valve timing</a> (intake side) system applied to passenger car diesel engines.
All engines developed within this family have <a href="aluminium">aluminium</a> <a href="cylinder%20block">cylinder block</a>, <a href="double%20overhead%20camshaft">double overhead camshaft</a> layouts, <a href="Multi-valve%23Four%20valves">4 valves per cylinder</a>, a <a href="common%20rail">common rail</a> injection system with a <a href="variable-geometry%20turbocharger">variable-geometry turbocharger</a> and "<a href="MIVEC">MIVEC</a>" variable valve timing.
Engine family characteristics.
Mitsubishi's new clean diesel engines use a high-pressure common rail injection system to improve <a href="Internal%20combustion%20engine">combustion efficiency</a>. The "4N13" uses <a href="solenoid">solenoid</a> fuel-injectors. The larger "4N14" engine uses <a href="Piezoelectricity">piezo</a> fuel-injectors that produce a finer fuel spray. Both engines feature a fast <a href="ceramic">ceramic</a> <a href="glowplug">glowplug</a> system. The engines are designed to operate at a lower <a href="compression%20ratio">compression ratio</a>, thus lowering the combustion pressure, allowing the use of an aluminium cylinder block that reduces <a href="weight">weight</a>.
The "4N13" engine uses a Variable Geometry (VG) turbocharger with a variable vane <a href="turbine">turbine</a>, which provides optimal <a href="Boost%20controller">boost pressure</a> control for different driving conditions. The "4N14" engine also uses a VG turbocharger plus a Variable Diffuser (VD) that uses both variable geometry vanes in the turbine housing and a <a href="gas%20compressor">compressor</a> with variable vanes in the diffuser passage, further improving combustion efficiency.
Within the engine, Mitsubishi used an offset angle <a href="crankshaft">crankshaft</a> that reduces friction, therefore noise and vibration, allowing the engine to run smoothly and quietly at all <a href="Revolutions%20per%20minute">engine speeds</a>.
To meet the requirements of global <a href="Exhaust%20gas">emissions</a> standards, Mitsubishi developed a new catalyst system that combines a <a href="Diesel%20particulate%20filter%23Diesel_Oxidation_Catalyst_.28DOC.29">Diesel Oxidation Catalyst</a> (DOC), <a href="NOx%20adsorber">NOx Trap Catalyst</a> (NTC) and <a href="Diesel%20Particulate%20Filter">Diesel Particulate Filter</a> (DPF).
